oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poe Sisters performances - Grand Ole Opry - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Various excerpts from the radio program the Grand Ole Opry, featuring the Poe Sisters, Ruth and Nelle Poe (performers) and George D. Hay (announcer), broadcast some time during the mid 1940s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Poe Sisters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Nelle Poe introduces the recording -- (00:22) George D. Hay introduces the Poe Sisters -- (00:30) As Long As I Live (Poe Sisters) -- (02:55) Hay introduces the next tune -- A Flower Blooming In The Wildwood (Poe Sisters) -- (05:30) Hay introduces the Poe Sisters -- (05:43) Don't Let Your Sweet Love Die (Poe Sisters) -- (07:50) Hay introduces the next tune -- (07:55) Have I Told You Lately? (Poe Sisters) -- (10:16) Hay introduces the next tune -- (10:20) In A Village Church Yard (Poe Sisters) -- (12:20) Hay introduces the next tune -- (12:28) False Hearted Girl (Poe Sisters) -- (14:42) Hay introduces the next tune -- Farmer's Son (Poe Sisters) -- (16:37) Hay introduces the next tune -- Green Valley Waltz (Poe Sisters) -- (18:53) Sorrow We Must Die (Poe Sisters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand Ole Opry (Radio program);
